headings: Are you fascinated by rock formations and volcanoes?
What Can You Do With a Geoscience Degree?
Why Earn My Geoscience Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: Do you like to work outdoors and don’t mind getting your hands dirty? Are you interested in geology and the structure of the earth? Maybe your interests lie in the country’s energy sources or studying earthquakes or volcanoes. If any of these ideas catch your eye, then a geoscience major could be just right for you.

Our wide-ranging geoscience degree program covers everything from structural geology, mineralogy, meteorology and stratigraphy - to hydrology, geochemistry, geophysics and volcanology. You’ll also participate in top-level research and field studies, which will give you a competitive edge when applying for a job or for graduate school.
Contact Information

Our faculty are dedicated to teaching, field studies and research. They also bring practical field and industry experience to the classroom, so you get a well-rounded learning experience. You can collaborate with them on research projects, and our small class and lab sizes allow you to make strong connections with each of your professors.
Geoscience Faculty and Staff
ASU Distinguished ScholarshipsOur premier scholarships are awarded based on your academic achievement, and you don’t even have to apply. You are automatically considered once you are admitted to ASU.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.
Blue and Gold GuaranteeIf you have financial need, you may qualify forfree tuitionto attend Angelo State.

A geoscience degree will prepare you for a variety of career fields, including geology, the oil and gas industry, environmental agencies, water resource management and planetary science, among others.
Particular areas of job growth include geologists, hydrologists, environmental and conservation scientists, meteorologists and atmospheric scientists.
Our graduates also have a 100% acceptance rate to graduate school for geosciences.
Explore Career Possibilities

You’ll experience the diverse geology of Texas and the western U.S. when you join your fellow students and professors for field trips and Summer Field Camp. Visit sites like the Permian Basin, Big Bend, Caprock Canyon, New Mexico volcanoes and Mount St. Helens.

We encourage all our students to conduct research projects alongside our faculty. Many of our students present their findings at national conferences, and several have won prestigious awards. We can also help you obtain summer research opportunities sponsored by the National Science Foundation around the country.

You’ll be exposed to internship and service-learning opportunities when you join our Geologic Exhibition Organization student group. Network with geology professionals, participate in outreach activities and attend national conferences while you connect and bond with your fellow students and professors.

Take your education to the next level in theASU Honors Program. Through special courses, cultural events, research and community engagement, we’ll help you transform your intellectual and personal talents into marketable skills for your future. You’ll also have the opportunity to participate in prestigious internships, fellowships and other programs to reach your full potential.
Explore the Honors Advantage
